message: This topic automatically created via wp-convore for http://www.michaelridley.info/2011/03/05/wordpress-convore-plugin/

I noticed that I stated in my post that you need a "dedicated" Convore group for the WordPress site.  I suppose that's not exactly correct.  Obviously anyone can post topics to the group other than what's automatically created by WordPress.
clever. would site «comments» update in realtime too?
a convore page for each blog? interesting.
@dpwiz glad you like.  It occurs to me that I'm not updating the widget contents of users online in real time which I probably should do.  I'll probably add that.

I should also change it so that the usernames hyperlink to the Convore profile.  I thought about also supporting inline URLs and images as with the Convore site but I'm not sure if that would be a good feature or not.  Maybe good to have it as an option...I just worry about the security implications - would have to make sure people couldn't inject JavaScript or other malicious stuff.  But perhaps there's a PHP library that takes care of that so I don't have to create it from scratch.

@bat I think Convore will have better growth if it has the capability to be more viral and not be limited to the Convore web site.  If I were really ambitious I'd make a Drupal plugin too, but since I'm not getting paid I'm probably not that ambitious :-)
